intro: Becium affine var. cyclophyllum, commonly known as the cyclophyll becium, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, followed by pod fruits containing several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered vulnerable to environmental changes and human encroachment. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this unique botanical species.
